sage.networking.client

Class UDPClientSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.DatagramSocket
      • sage.networking.client.UDPClientSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, IClientSocket

    public class UDPClientSocket
extends java.net.DatagramSocket
implements IClientSocket
    A client socket for sending and receiving packets using the UDP protocol. This socket is able to send and receive Serializable objects from client side of a game. The underlying DatagramSocket is used in this implementation.
    Author:
    Kyle Matz
    See Also:
    DatagramSocket

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UDPClientSocket()
      Creates an unconnected socket.
      UDPClientSocket(java.net.InetAddress remoteAddr, int remotePort)
      Constructs a socket connected to the remote address and remote port specified.
      UDPClientSocket(java.net.InetAddress remoteAddr, int remotePort, java.net.InetAddress localAddr, int localPort)
      Constructs a socket bound to the local port and address and connected to the remote address and remote port.
      UDPClientSocket(java.net.InetAddress remoteAddr, int remotePort, int localPort)
      Constructs a socket bound to the local port and connected to the remote address and remote port.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UDPClientSocket

        public UDPClientSocket()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an unconnected socket. This socket should be connected via connectTo(InetAddress, int) before being used. See DatagramSocket.DatagramSocket() for local binding information.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • UDPClientSocket

        public UDPClientSocket(java.net.InetAddress remoteAddr,
                       int remotePort)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a socket connected to the remote address and remote port specified. Connected should be true upon returning from this method. See DatagramSocket.DatagramSocket() for local binding information.
        Parameters:
        remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
        remotePort - remote port to connect to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • UDPClientSocket

        public UDPClientSocket(java.net.InetAddress remoteAddr,
                       int remotePort,
                       int localPort)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a socket bound to the local port and connected to the remote address and remote port. Connected should be true upon returning from this method. See DatagramSocket.DatagramSocket(int) for local binding information.
        Parameters:
        remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
        remotePort - remote port to connect to.
        localPort - local port to bind to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • UDPClientSocket

        public UDPClientSocket(java.net.InetAddress remoteAddr,
                       int remotePort,
                       java.net.InetAddress localAddr,
                       int localPort)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a socket bound to the local port and address and connected to the remote address and remote port. Connected should be true upon returning from this method. See DatagramSocket.DatagramSocket(int, InetAddress) for local binding information.
        Parameters:
        remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
        remotePort - remote port to connect to.
        localAddr - local address to bind to.
        localPort - local port to bind to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

                      int remotePort)
               throws java.io.IOException

        public void send(java.io.Serializable object)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a Serializable object to the remote InetAddress and port that this client socket is connected to. Will throw an exception if isConnected() is false.
